title: Trump’s Relentless Self-Promotion Fosters an American Cult of Personality
summary: President Trump has engaged in a spree of self-aggrandizement unlike any of his predecessors, fostering a mythologized superhuman persona and making himself the inescapable force at home and around the world.

title: More Than Ever, Videos Expose the Truth. And Cloud It, Too.
summary: In Minneapolis, videos of the Alex Pretti killing undermined the federal government’s account. But an A.I. video of Brad Pitt shows the dangers ahead.

title: Texas Students Protest ICE Despite Gov. Greg Abbott’s Threats
summary: In dozens of states, students have staged walkouts over immigration enforcement. In Texas, they’re doing so despite threats from Gov. Greg Abbott.

title: U.S. Deports Nine Migrants in Secret, Ignoring Legal Protections
summary: Most had court orders protecting them from removal to their home countries, so they were sent to detention in Cameroon.

title: Republican State Legislators Rush to Limit Their Own Regulators
summary: South Carolina’s state legislature is one of 17, mainly in heavily Republican states, that is moving to handcuff state agencies at a moment of tectonic changes in energy, technology and finance.

title: Shivering Americans Snap Up Firewood as Winter Grinds On
summary: Weeks of freezing temperatures and winter storms across parts of the United States have increased the demand for firewood and manufactured fire logs.

title: You’d Be Surprised to See Where Many Olympians Keep Their Medals
summary: Athletes train and sweat for years in pursuit of the glittering prizes. Many store them in the least glamorous places.

title: Making the Dancing Lions for Lunar New York Celebrations
summary: In a San Francisco garage, Corey Chan and his team create giant, spectacular lions that will lead the festivities.

title: What They Wanted From Jeffrey Epstein
summary: His network may not have known everything, but it is hard to deny that many of them knew enough to know better.

title: The Olympics Take Themselves Too Seriously. Bring Back Ski Ballet.
summary: You want at least one weird entree on the Olympics menu, even if only for the pleasure of not ordering it.

title: Iran Protester Dies in Custody, Raising Fears of Execution
summary: Rights groups are investigating the death of Ali Rahbar as a potential extrajudicial killing. Iran denies executions have taken place.

title: Islamist Party’s Rise Overshadows Student Revolution in Bangladesh
summary: The party is dedicated to running the country under Islamic law, but ran on a more moderate platform. It gained far more seats in last week’s election than it ever had before.

title: Software? No Way. We’re an A.I. Company Now!
summary: As their stocks tank, software makers are rebranding themselves as A.I. innovators. Sparkle emojis are everywhere, but some efforts have been more successful than others.

title: What We Know About the Kidnapping of Nancy Guthrie, Savannah Guthrie’s Mother
summary: Nancy Guthrie, 84, the “Today” show anchor’s mother, vanished from her Arizona home on Feb. 1. In the time since, very little new information has come to light.
